vision.notes: Oreosomatidae possess large eyes, indicating the importance of vision in their deep-sea habitat. This is further supported by the common name 'ox-eyed oreo'.

mechanoreception.notes: As fish, oreos likely possess a lateral line system for detecting water movement and pressure changes, aiding in prey detection and predator avoidance. Living at depths of 400-1500m (Pseudocyttus maculatus) implies sensitivity to pressure.

chemoreception.notes: Likely use chemoreception for locating food in the deep sea. This includes both taste (contact chemoreception) and smell (distance chemoreception).

electroreception.notes: The presence or absence of electroreception is unknown in this family. Further research is needed.
